speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: SCENE V. OLIVIA's garden.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come thy ways, Signior Fabian.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Nay, I'll come: if I lose a scruple of this sport,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: let me be boiled to death with melancholy.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Wouldst thou not be glad to have the niggardly

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: rascally sheep-biter come by some notable shame?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: I would exult, man: you know, he brought me out o'

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: favour with my lady about a bear-baiting here.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To anger him we'll have the bear again; and we will

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: fool him black and blue: shall we not, Sir Andrew?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: An we do not, it is pity of our lives.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Here comes the little villain.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter MARIA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: How now, my metal of India!

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Get ye all three into the box-tree: Malvolio's

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: coming down this walk: he has been yonder i' the

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: sun practising behavior to his own shadow this half

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: hour: observe him, for the love of mockery; for I

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: know this letter will make a contemplative idiot of

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: him. Close, in the name of jesting! Lie thou there,

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Throws down a letter

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: for here comes the trout that must be caught with tickling.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Enter MALVOLIO

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Tis but fortune; all is fortune. Maria once told

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me she did affect me: and I have heard herself come

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thus near, that, should she fancy, it should be one

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: of my complexion. Besides, she uses me with a more

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: exalted respect than any one else that follows her.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: What should I think on't?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Here's an overweening rogue!

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: O, peace! Contemplation makes a rare turkey-cock

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: of him: how he jets under his advanced plumes!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: 'Slight, I could so beat the rogue!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Peace, I say.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: To be Count Malvolio!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Ah, rogue!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Pistol him, pistol him.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Peace, peace!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: There is example for't; the lady of the Strachy

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: married the yeoman of the wardrobe.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Fie on him, Jezebel!

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: O, peace! now he's deeply in: look how

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: imagination blows him.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Having been three months married to her, sitting in

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: my state,--

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: O, for a stone-bow, to hit him in the eye!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Calling my officers about me, in my branched velvet

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: gown; having come from a day-bed, where I have left

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Olivia sleeping,--

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Fire and brimstone!

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: O, peace, peace!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: And then to have the humour of state; and after a

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: demure travel of regard, telling them I know my

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: place as I would they should do theirs, to for my

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: kinsman Toby,--

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Bolts and shackles!

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: O peace, peace, peace! now, now.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Seven of my people, with an obedient start, make

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: out for him: I frown the while; and perchance wind

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: up watch, or play with my--some rich jewel. Toby

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: approaches; courtesies there to me,--

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Shall this fellow live?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Though our silence be drawn from us with cars, yet peace.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I extend my hand to him thus, quenching my familiar

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: smile with an austere regard of control,--

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And does not Toby take you a blow o' the lips then?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Saying, 'Cousin Toby, my fortunes having cast me on

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: your niece give me this prerogative of speech,'--

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: What, what?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'You must amend your drunkenness.'

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Out, scab!

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Nay, patience, or we break the sinews of our plot.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Besides, you waste the treasure of your time with

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: a foolish knight,'--

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: That's me, I warrant you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'One Sir Andrew,'--

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I knew 'twas I; for many do call me fool.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: What employment have we here?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Taking up the letter

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Now is the woodcock near the gin.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: O, peace! and the spirit of humour intimate reading

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: aloud to him!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: By my life, this is my lady's hand these be her

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: very C's, her U's and her T's and thus makes she her

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: great P's. It is, in contempt of question, her hand.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Her C's, her U's and her T's: why that?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: [Reads]  'To the unknown beloved, this, and my good

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: wishes:'--her very phrases! By your leave, wax.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Soft! and the impressure her Lucrece, with which she

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: uses to seal: 'tis my lady. To whom should this be?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: This wins him, liver and all.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Jove knows I love: But who?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Lips, do not move;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: No man must know.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'No man must know.' What follows? the numbers

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: altered! 'No man must know:' if this should be

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thee, Malvolio?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Marry, hang thee, brock!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I may command where I adore;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: But silence, like a Lucrece knife,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: With bloodless stroke my heart doth gore:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: A fustian riddle!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Excellent wench, say I.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.' Nay, but first, let

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me see, let me see, let me see.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: What dish o' poison has she dressed him!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And with what wing the staniel cheques at it!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'I may command where I adore.' Why, she may command

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me: I serve her; she is my lady. Why, this is

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: evident to any formal capacity; there is no

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: obstruction in this: and the end,--what should

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that alphabetical position portend? If I could make

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that resemble something in me,--Softly! M, O, A,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: O, ay, make up that: he is now at a cold scent.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Sowter will cry upon't for all this, though it be as

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: rank as a fox.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M,--Malvolio; M,--why, that begins my name.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Did not I say he would work it out? the cur is

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: excellent at faults.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M,--but then there is no consonancy in the sequel;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that suffers under probation A should follow but O does.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: And O shall end, I hope.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Ay, or I'll cudgel him, and make him cry O!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: And then I comes behind.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Ay, an you had any eye behind you, you might see

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: more detraction at your heels than fortunes before

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M, O, A, I; this simulation is not as the former: and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: yet, to crush this a little, it would bow to me, for

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: every one of these letters are in my name. Soft!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: here follows prose.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'If this fall into thy hand, revolve. In my stars I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: am above thee; but be not afraid of greatness: some

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: are born great, some achieve greatness, and some

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: have greatness thrust upon 'em. Thy Fates open

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: their hands; let thy blood and spirit embrace them;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: and, to inure thyself to what thou art like to be,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cast thy humble slough and appear fresh. Be

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: opposite with a kinsman, surly with servants; let

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thy tongue tang arguments of state; put thyself into

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: the trick of singularity: she thus advises thee

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that sighs for thee. Remember who commended thy

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: yellow stockings, and wished to see thee ever

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cross-gartered: I say, remember. Go to, thou art

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: made, if thou desirest to be so; if not, let me see

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thee a steward still, the fellow of servants, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: not worthy to touch Fortune's fingers. Farewell.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: She that would alter services with thee,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: THE FORTUNATE-UNHAPPY.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Daylight and champaign discovers not more: this is

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: open. I will be proud, I will read politic authors,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I will baffle Sir Toby, I will wash off gross

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: acquaintance, I will be point-devise the very man.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I do not now fool myself, to let imagination jade

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me; for every reason excites to this, that my lady

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: loves me. She did commend my yellow stockings of

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: late, she did praise my leg being cross-gartered;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: and in this she manifests herself to my love, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: with a kind of injunction drives me to these habits

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: of her liking. I thank my stars I am happy. I will

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: be strange, stout, in yellow stockings, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cross-gartered, even with the swiftness of putting

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: on. Jove and my stars be praised! Here is yet a

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: postscript.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Thou canst not choose but know who I am. If thou

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: entertainest my love, let it appear in thy smiling;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thy smiles become thee well; therefore in my

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: presence still smile, dear my sweet, I prithee.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Jove, I thank thee: I will smile; I will do

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: everything that thou wilt have me.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: I will not give my part of this sport for a pension

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: of thousands to be paid from the Sophy.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I could marry this wench for this device.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: So could I too.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And ask no other dowry with her but such another jest.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Nor I neither.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Here comes my noble gull-catcher.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Re-enter MARIA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Wilt thou set thy foot o' my neck?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Or o' mine either?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Shall I play my freedom at traytrip, and become thy

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: bond-slave?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I' faith, or I either?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Why, thou hast put him in such a dream, that when

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: the image of it leaves him he must run mad.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Nay, but say true; does it work upon him?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Like aqua-vitae with a midwife.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: If you will then see the fruits of the sport, mark

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: his first approach before my lady: he will come to

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: her in yellow stockings, and 'tis a colour she

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: abhors, and cross-gartered, a fashion she detests;

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: and he will smile upon her, which will now be so

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: unsuitable to her disposition, being addicted to a

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: melancholy as she is, that it cannot but turn him

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: into a notable contempt. If you will see it, follow

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: me.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To the gates of Tartar, thou most excellent devil of wit!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I'll make one too.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Exeunt
